lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

host.description: Hostname or IP of the server on which CS server is running

port.description: Port on which ChatScript is listening to

botName.description: Name of the Bot in CS to converse with

chatUserName.description: Username who initializes the CS conversation. To be set when chat is initialized from camel route

resetChat.description: Issues :reset command to start a new conversation everytime

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).
